      • getProvider

        @NotNull
public static AppInfo.AppInfoProvider getProvider()
        Attempts to get the AppInfoProvider that has been registered for this application. If one has not been registered, it attempts to get one by calling getAppInfo() on the application's main class (if it exists). Otherwise a default AppInfoProvider is created and returned. This default provides no valuable information, so it is suggested that each application registers its own AppInfoProvider in main().

      • setAppName
